intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to add window images, add a splash screen and customize a launcher for an RCP application using PDE.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in development perspective
item.description:
To open the plug-in development perspective, select Window->Open Perspective->Other... and choose Plug-in Development.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Open the product editor
item.description:
To open the product editor (if it is not already open), expand the com.example.rcpapp tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the rcpapp.product file (the Overview page should be open initially).
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Add window images
item.description: To add window images, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Branding" tab within the product editor to display the "Branding" page
Click the "Browse" button adjacent to the "16x16" text box under the "Window Images" heading
Fully expand the "com.example.rcpapp" tree in the "Image Selection" dialog box and select "alt_window_16.gif" and click "OK"
Click the "Browse" button adjacent to the "32x32" text box under the "Window Images" heading
Fully expand the "com.example.rcpapp" tree in the "Image Selection" dialog box and select "alt_window_32.gif" and click "OK"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu

item.title: Test the RCP product
item.description: To test the RCP product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Overview" tab within the product editor to display the "Overview" page
Click the "Launch an Eclipse Application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading
Note the image in the window title bar (if applicable on your platform)
Exit the RCP application

item.title: Add a splash screen
item.description: To add a splash screen, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Splash" tab within the product editor to display the "Splash" page
Click the "Browse..." button adjacent to the "Plug-in" text box under the "Location" heading
Select the "com.example.rcpapp" entry in the "Plug-in Selection" dialog box and click "OK"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu
Note: Eclipse expects a file called "splash.bmp" to be located in the root of the specified plug-in. Verify that the root folder of "com.example.rcpapp" plug-in has the "splash.bmp".

item.title: Alternative: Add a splash screen via VM arguments to a plugin (no .product file)
item.description:
You can show a custom splash screen without editing a .product file by passing one of the following system properties as a VM argument (not a Program argument):
- -Dosgi.splashLocation=<absolute path to splash.bmp>
Points directly to the splash image file. This is an absolute path to the image named exactly splash.bmp. It overrides any value set in osgi.splashPath.
Example (Linux/macOS):
-Dosgi.splashLocation="/absolute/path/to/splash.bmp"
Example (Windows):
-Dosgi.splashLocation="C:\absolute\path\to\splash.bmp"
- -Dosgi.splashPath=file:/<base path to directory>
Points to one or more base directories or plug-ins. Eclipse will search each base location for a file named exactly splash.bmp in its root.
Example (Linux/macOS):
-Dosgi.splashPath=file:/base/path/to/directory/
Example (Windows):
-Dosgi.splashPath=file:/C:/base/path/to/directory/
Important:
- Always place these in the VM arguments field, not Program arguments.
- The splash image file must be named splash.bmp for both arguments — other filenames will not be recognized.
- osgi.splashLocation accepts only a single absolute path to splash.bmp.
- osgi.splashPath accepts one or more base paths (comma-separated) and searches each for splash.bmp.
- If both are specified, osgi.splashLocation takes precedence.

subitem.label: Create a new plug-in project: In the Plug-in Development perspective, select File -> New -> Project -> Plug-in Project.
Enter a project name (e.g., com.example.splashdemo) and click Finish.
Import your splash image: Right-click the new plug-in project, select Import… -> General -> File System, browse to your splash.bmp file, and select it.
Ensure the image is named splash.bmp and placed at the correct location for your chosen argument type.
Right-click splash.bmp and select Properties -> Resource to note its location or relative path, then copy the full path.
Open Run Configurations, select your launch configuration, and go to the Arguments tab.
In the VM arguments section, enter either -Dosgi.splashPath or -Dosgi.splashLocation with the appropriate path to splash.bmp.
Click Apply, then Run to launch with your custom splash screen.

item.title: Test the RCP product
item.description: To test the RCP product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Overview" tab within the product editor to display the "Overview" page
Click the "Launch an Eclipse Application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading
Note the splash screen displayed before the RCP application window is visible
Exit the RCP application

item.title: Customize the launcher
item.description:
We will walk through this task assuming we are working on a Windows platform (Similar steps may be followed for other platforms).
To customize the launcher, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Launching" tab within the product editor to display the "Launching" page
Input "rcpapp" into the "Launcher Name" text box under the "Program Launcher" heading
Select the "win32" tab under the "Program Launcher" heading
Select the "Use a single ICO file containing 6 images as specified above" radio button
Click the "Browse..." button adjacent to the "File" text box
Fully expand the "com.example.rcpapp" tree in the "Image Selection" dialog box and select "alt_launcher.ico" and click "OK"
Select "File->Save" from the main menu
